About Me

Hello, my name is Kyle Jian. I am a 3rd year Mechatronics & AI Systems Engineering student at the University of Western Ontario. I'm a curious and creative individual with a deep passion for technology and the art of sound. I love exploring how innovative ideas and engineering come together to shape experiences, whether I'm tinkering with vintage audio gear or diving into new coding challenges. I value continuous learning, collaboration, and the joy of uncovering how things work, always striving to find unique solutions that blend creativity with technical insight.

Sodecia Automotive London Inc.

Assistant Maintenance Planner - July 2024 - September 2024

As an Assistant Maintenance Planner at Sodecia Automotive London Inc., I was responsible for transitioning maintenance operations from traditional paper-based methods to a streamlined digital system using ManagerPlus 2019. In this role, I collaborated closely with various departments to optimize workflow processes, manage and analyze data, and ensure that staff were fully equipped to adopt new digital practices.

  • Implemented the transition from paper to digital using ManagerPlus 2019, significantly improving efficiency and accountability.
  • Provided comprehensive training for maintenance staff and the incoming Maintenance Planner, ensuring effective use of the new digital system.
  • Collaborated with the Tooling and Quality departments to streamline processes and enhance operational performance.

STAX SRM-006t CCS & 6SN7 Conversion

Using a STAX SRM-006t amplifier as a base, modification were possible to increase the signal performance. By adpting the constant current source (CCS) module (circuit design by Jame Lin) for both channels (Left & Right, +/-), the signal quality would significantly be increased. Custom PCBs for the CCS were designed and integrated into the amplifier.

Additionally, a circuit and PCB were developed to convert 6CG7 tubes to 6SN7 tubes, providing increased headroom and reduced distortions due to the 6SN7's higher current handling capacity and improved linearity compared to the 6CG7/6FQ7.

Aging components were also refurbished to enhance overall performance and lifespan of the amplifier.

Altium PCB Design Circuit Design Refurbishment Signal Overhaul

Western Sunstang - Steering Wheel Design

Independently designed a custom, fully 3D-printable steering wheel using Onshape CAD software for the Western Sungstang Solar Car Project. Focused on optimizing ergonomics and button placement for ease of use, with thorough research to ensure comfort and functionality. The design adheres to specific guidelines, offering a personalized and practical solution for the competition.

CAD Research & Development Design Ergonomics Prototyping Onshape

One Haneded Rollator

Collaborated in a team to design a one-handed rollator using Onshape for 3D CAD modeling. Focused on ensuring effective steering and braking with one hand to enhance user convenience and safety. Engaged with clients to gather requirements and integrate their feedback into the design. Utilized woodshop machinery and tools to construct and test prototypes while maintaining project documentation and providing regular progress updates.

CAD Research & Development Design Ergonomics Prototyping Onshape Teamwork

WEEM - Longboard Truck CAD

Utilized SOLIDWORKS to model longboard trucks for the Western Engineering Electrium Mobility (WEEM) motorized longboard project. Focused on accuracy to match physical specifications, ensuring seamless integration with other design aspects of the board for optimal performance and planning.

SOLIDWORKS CAD Precision Design Prototyping
